location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: ‘Secret Letters received, by way of Marseilles, May 21.1856’

mods.abstract: This bundle consists of summaries, and partial transcripts, of secret letters received from the Government of Bombay (16 and 25 April 1856, Numbers 27-29). The amount of detail for each entry therefore varies.The despatches consist of updates from Aden, the Persian Gulf, and Sind. They include discussion of ‘treasonable correspondence between Ali Boo Bekr and the Foutheli Chief', proposals to remove the Al Ali from Demaun, and the British blockade of Berbera.
